title: U.S. disposable personal income - monthly percentage of change 2019/20
summary: This bar chart has 13 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Monthly percentage of change in each Month on the y axis.
The Monthly percentage of change is highest at Month Jan '20 and lowest at Month Oct '19.
The highest Month Jan '20 has 0.6 more Monthly percentage of change than the lowest Month Oct '19.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Monthly percentage of change for 13 number of Months.
The Monthly percentage of change is appeared to be the highest at Month Jan '20 and lowest at Month Oct '19.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 13 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Monthly percentage of change in each Month on the y axis.
The Monthly percentage of change is highest at Month Jan '20 and lowest at Month Oct '19.
The highest Month Jan '20 has 0.6 more Monthly percentage of change than the lowest Month Oct '19.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Monthly percentage of change for 13 number of Months.
The Monthly percentage of change is highest at Month Jan '20 and lowest at Month Oct '19.
Month Aug '19 has the second highest value for Monthly percentage of change.
The highest Month Jan '20 has 0.6 more Monthly percentage of change than the lowest Month Oct '19.
The Month Jan '20 has the highest Monthly percentage of change, followed by Aug '19, and Feb '19. Down to the Month Oct '19 which is the lowest.
The Monthly percentage of change has lowered over the past 13 Months.
Month Nov '19, Jun '19, Apr '19, and Mar '19 have the same Monthly percentage of change.
The average Monthly percentage of change in all 13 Months is 0.35.
